description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Enchanted Naples" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Enchanted Naples

places.generalDescription: Discover the hidden world of Underground Naples, a vast network of ancient tunnels and chambers that lie beneath the modern streets of the city. This underground city spans over 40 miles and dates back to ancient Greek times when it was used for stone extraction. Over the centuries, it was expanded by Romans and Bourbons for various purposes including as an aqueduct. Visitors can explore this mystical place, descending about 40 meters below street level to witness remnants of the Greek-Roman theatre and other historical sites.

sources.snippet: Hidden beneath the modern streets of Naples hides another historic city: Naples Underground (Naples Underground), a network of ancient tunnels, chambers, and passageways that run under the historic center. One of the largest and most complete underground urban areas in the world, Napoli Sotteranea includes more than 40 miles of tunnels. The network was created by the ancient Greeks to extract stone to use as building materials as the city grew, but was expanded by the Romans and later by the Bourbons to be used as an aqueduct to bring water to the city‚Äôs residents.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things to See in Naples - The Ultimate Guide

sources.snippet: Not far away, right among the streets of the historic center of Naples, there is the access to the intriguing underground Naples. This is a network of tunnels and water wells that constituted the aqueduct from which water was once drawn for Neapolitan houses.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Naples: all the places¬†of love

sources.snippet: For couples enamored with history and culture, the secrets of Underground Naples or a visit to the charming Castel dell‚ÄôOvo, and the Royal Palace, near the famous Piazza del Plebiscito that has free access, is a must.
sources.shortName: Things to Do for Couples in Naples, Italy: Romantic Activities for Every Season
19 Romantic Things to do in Naples for Couples [2024]

places.name: Underground Naples

reviews.text:
It's completely awe inducing. The place itself it's already great, but when you listen to the explanations of the history of the place by the tour guides, and then you walk through the narrow tunnels and water basins, it really gives you a sense of how amazing this place is, and how genius/brave ancient Greeks and Romans were. For me, if you're in Napoli, it's a must.

Pd: if you're claustrophobic, keep in mind that there's an extremely narrow tunnel (80cm wide for the most part, but one very small part is around 50cm) which is like 80m long, and another one like that but pretty short, maybe 15-20m long. However, it never feels too enclosed due to the sound of water close by, and the fact that the rest of the place is pretty big (very high ceilings and wide spaces).

Was cool to experience- went on the English tour however I had to translate for those in my group. Was just hard to understand especially with all of the echoes in there.

There is a part when you go through tunnels and would not recommended doing that part if you are claustrophobic. It's VERY tight, you have to turn and walk sideways. You can opt out and your group will circle back.

Absolutely amazing!!! This place is massive!! I just wish there was a way to tour even more. There are tunnels for days. The paths they let you take that are so narrow that I had to walk sideways. Though not required.
So amazing to see the water system that served the city for generations.  There are many stairs to get in and out. But a little cooler down there makes it a little easier to do.
The WWII history involved with these tunnels is amazing. Such a fascinating place! Well worth the visit. Bought my tickets the night before. Visited in mid may.

places.address: Piazza San Gaetano, 69, 80138 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Archaeological Park of Herculaneum is a site that preserves the remains of the ancient city destroyed by Mount Vesuvius. It is part of a larger group of attractions in Naples and its surroundings. The park offers a unique insight into the daily life and culture of the ancient inhabitants through its excavations and precious artifacts. The Archaeological Museum of Herculaneum holds an exceptional collection that further enriches visitors' understanding of this civilization.

sources.snippet: A wide range of culturally and historically significant sites are nearby, including the Palace of Caserta and the Roman ruins of Pompeii and Herculaneum. Naples is also known for its natural beauties, such as Posillipo, Phlegraean Fields, Nisida, and Vesuvius. Naples is one of the most ancient cities in Europe, whose contemporary urban fabric preserves the elements of its long and eventful history.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic THINGS TO DO IN NAPLES ITALY Ideas | by Sutikshan Dwivedi
Honeymoon In Naples | A Romantic Haven

places.name: Archaeological Park of Herculaneum

reviews.text:
I could go on for hours. So I will be succinct with the basics.

‚Ä¢ Book a guided tour.
‚Ä¢ Travel light.
‚Ä¢ Bring water.

Honestly, booking a tour guide is the best thing to do. You will get so much out of this place with one.

Herculaneum is a lot smaller than Pompeii, and it's pretty well preserved. There are lots of things to see and two little museums, which are amazing.

There are a few vending machines to get food/drinks/ice cream/sandwiches. Limited seating, so be prepared to stand in the heat.

Overall, go and experience this very special and ancient site. Touch the buildings, walk on the streets, and feel the history!

We got the tickets and information about the tour from a friendly vendor in a ticket booth on the street.
We ended up having to walk a little from that place and cross the street 2 times, to reach Via Medina, where the bus station was.
The bus was pretty empty so there was no worries about seating on both trips. On the way to the ruins, the bus came on time. On the way back, though, it was delayed like 20min from the official pick up time and we got there before that so we waited a long time. Our main worry was that we tried calling the emergency number, after 15min, like 5 times and no one answered. But at least, after the bus came the guide apologised for the delay by blaming thw traffic.
From the buss station where we were dropped off we walked another 10min to reach the ruins. There you need to buy tickets to visit. They also have small storage boxes which are free of charge. Caution though, big backpacks may not fit especially if they're loaded.
The ruins were a very cool and unique experience, we wanted to take our time and didn't go with a guide. What we thought was unnecessary, was the only one way in and out of that place when other options were closed off to the public.

Herculaneum is absolutely mind-blowing. Smaller and less crowded than Pompeii, but in many ways even more impressive. The level of preservation here is unreal-second stories still standing, wooden doors, roof beams, furniture, even food remnants. It's like the eruption happened yesterday.

We did a private tour with an archaeologist (highly recommend!) who helped bring it all to life-explaining how this seaside town functioned before the eruption and why it was preserved so differently from Pompeii. The contrast between the two sites is fascinating.

It's more compact than Pompeii, but every corner is packed with detail and history. And the best part? It's not swarming with tourists, so you can really take your time and soak it all in.

Don't skip this one-Herculaneum is a must. Quiet, powerful, and unforgettable.

places.address: Corso Resina, 187, 80056 Ercolano NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Complesso Monumentale di Santa Chiara is a religious complex in Naples dating back to the 1300s. It includes a vast church, beautifully adorned with 17th-century frescos and exquisite majolica tiling. The cloister garden offers a serene escape with fragrant citrus trees and lilac lavender blooms, along with 72 ceramic-tiled columns decorated with hand-painted flowers, grapes, and rural scenes.

sources.snippet: The Monastery of Santa Chiara (Complesso Monumentale di Santa Chiara) is a peaceful retreat from the bustling city of Naples. This gothic monastery was founded in 1313 and quickly became an important center of culture and learning; today its museum houses an impressive collection of 14th-century art and artifacts. Explore the museum, library with over 30,000 volumes, and the picturesque cloister gardens, completely decorated in ornate hand-painted majolica tiles and benches.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things to See in Naples - The Ultimate Guide
Honeymoon In Naples | A Romantic Haven

places.name: Complesso Monumentale di Santa Chiara

reviews.text:
We were stopping by Napoli to fly out back home in Sept 2022. We didn't have any plans so we just stumbled upon this place.  The architecture is stunning, with beautiful mosaic tiles, murals, and peaceful gardens. It was the perfect spot to relax and soak in the sun.

There were a good number of people, but it didn't feel crowded, which made it even more enjoyable. It was a nice, quiet place to unwind before heading home. Definitely a hidden gem in Naples!
A peaceful oasis in the heart of Naples, with stunning Gothic architecture and a breathtaking cloister decorated in colorful 18th-century majolica tiles. A must-see for history and art lovers.

A small but charming monastery in the heart of Naples. The famous courtyard, which is usually the highlight, was unfortunately under construction during my visit, which took away some of the atmosphere. Still, it's a peaceful and beautiful spot, offering a welcome break from the busy streets outside. The adjoining church is very impressive and definitely worth a visit.

places.address: Via Santa Chiara, 49/c, 80134 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: San Carlo Theatre, located near the Royal Palace and Galleria Umberto in Naples, is the oldest continuously running public opera venue globally. Commissioned by King Charles III of Naples and restored after a fire in 1816, it boasts a magnificent Neoclassical building with an opulent horseshoe-shaped auditorium and stunning red and gold furnishings. The venue offers guided tours that include visits to foyers, the main hall, and the royal box.

sources.snippet: If you prefer a breath of beauty and superior culture, beyond a beautiful declaration you can take advantage of it and immerse yourself in the wonderful context offered by the Teatro San Carlo, the oldest theater in Europe. On February 14, Igor Levit, a world-famous pianist, will enchant the audience with his notes. In the following days, however, you will be able to experience some of the most beautiful love stories such as Rom√©o et Juliette scheduled for Saturday 15.
sources.shortName: Exploring Naples on Valentine's Day: A Perfect Romantic Itinerary

sources.snippet: Conclude an evening by attending a show at the Teatro San Carlo, the oldest continuously active opera house in the world. The unparalleled magic of the Neapolitan stage is recognized throughout the world.
sources.shortName: Discover 10 romantic things to do in Naples in couple

sources.snippet: Moreover, a visit to the Basilica San Francesco di Paola, or the striking San Carlo Theatre, will provide rich and immersive experiences.
sources.shortName: Things to Do for Couples in Naples, Italy: Romantic Activities for Every Season

places.name: San Carlo Theatre

reviews.text: Our very first time watching Opera in Italy. ‚ÄúLa Boheme‚Äù was a good first production to watch,it was very well performed by the Italian cast. This beautiful and historical theatre made our Experience a very memorable one, watching here gave me goosebumps! We got seats in the balcony boxes, which was comfortable even if we shared with a few strangers. The feel , the smell and the vibes of the place transported me back to the olden days of Naples. A true Italian experience! Must visit when in Napoli.

Visited this theatre to watch the LA FANCIULLA DEL WEST opera. It was interesting to watch an opera in western theme, but the theater itself is magnificent.
We were sitting on a balcony on the second floor and we had a good view. The theater is in great condition, although it's very old and the acoustic is awesome. We also enjoyed  the music from the symphonic orchestra. The staff is very helpful and we managed to reach our seats very quickly. The breaks are many and quite big (around 25 minutes), so they make the play quite long.

Absolutely stunning place. The staff is very patient and great with tourists and locals alike. We came to see a opera when we where in Napoli and we're totally amazed by the theater and the opera on the same level. It's stunning. Even if you just come to see the inside of this amazing place you wil be stunned. We also had a opera on top what was also of ultra Hooghly quality. Ill matrimoni secreto. Super fun opera that has been adapted to the modern age mixed with old cstumes. Singing level is at the top.

places.address: Via San Carlo, 98, 80132 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Explore the ancient underground world of Naples with the Napoli Sotterranea Guided Authorized Tour. Delve 40 meters below the city's bustling streets to discover a hidden labyrinth of catacombs, tunnels, and caverns dating back over 2,400 years. This subterranean journey unveils layers of Greek and Roman structures, early Christian burial sites, and World War II air raid shelters.

sources.shortName: 10 Romantic THINGS TO DO IN NAPLES ITALY Ideas | by Sutikshan Dwivedi

places.name: Napoli Sotterranea Guided Authorized Tour

reviews.text:
Very interesting tour, worth the price. Very good guide, was telling a lot of interesting facts about the place and history of Naples in general. There were quite some people, a lot of separate groups with different languages, so when visitors were entering it was a bit stressful. But once inside - all great üëçüèº
We'd recommend booking it in advance online.
Our guide Alex was great!!

I really enjoyed this place! It really helps to understand the the Napoli as the guide provides lots of historical facts but in a very interesting way. Alex was a great guide! The temperature is around 18 C so I good to take some proper clothes. Very characteristic to this underground journey are veeeery narrow paths that used to be a aqueduct. Recommend to everybody who are visiting Napoli. In case of the tickets, easy to book online and pay before the entrance. Easy to find the place.

The tour was great, cash required at the door. 40m of steps down what used to be a well, then up 16m? back out of a well somewhere else, not far from entry. Our tour guide, Grace (the English version of her name) was brilliant and fun. From entry to exit was about 1hr30. There are some fun tight tunnels to squeeze through but if you cant manage it there are short cuts the tour guide can lead you through. I was always last taking photos so was chosen to be 'tail end charlie' to always confirm everyone was through the small tunnels. Best tourist catacombs tour out of the 4 I did.

places.address: Vico S. Anna di Palazzo, 52, 80132 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Museo e Real Bosco di Capodimonte is a hidden gem that offers an extensive public park, woodland paths, statues, and fountains. The museum is now home to one of the most comprehensive collections of Italian art, featuring masterpieces by renowned artists such as Titian, El Greco, Caravaggio, and Raphael.

sources.shortName: 10 romantic things to do in Naples

places.name: Museo e Real Bosco di Capodimonte

reviews.text: Lovely museum. Caravaggio alone is worth seeing. There is also tons of artists that were inspired & worked w/ him similar style on display. Lovely bar there as well were we had espresso & lunch. It's a bit out of the city but worth the taxi ride 100%

Large, breathtaking museum. One of the best ones I've been to in Italy. A must go when you're in Naples. Has 2 floors filled to the brim with paintings and even medieval knight armour. Besides, if you're tired from the experiences, a wonderful cafe on the first floor offers delicious coffee, pastries and even salads.

The museum currently has some renovations going on in the courtyard but the exhibits aren't affected. Interesting collection of pieces from Neapolitan churches from 14th century onwards, it was fascinating to see the progression of artistic style in such grand pieces. The collection on the first floor incorporates more varied subjects and styles.

places.address: Via Lucio Amelio, 2, 80131 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: After considering several options, including Fratelli di Bufala and Pizzeria Sorbillo, we settled on Starita. We visited Concettina ai Tre Santi and were not disappointed. We tried the Margherita and Il Sole della Sanita pizzas, both of which were exceptional. The ingredients were top-notch, with fresh mozzarella and tomatoes from Naples. The crust was fluffy and delicious, while the yellow tomatoes on Il Sole della Sanita were a true delight.

sources.shortName: Honeymoon In Naples | A Romantic Haven

places.name: Starita

reviews.text:
A pizzeria always crowded with local people rather than tourists. Located a bit north of city center, where you can reach around 15 min. by either metro or bus. They are open for dinner at 19:00 sharp, but many guests had made a line at the opening time, which means you would not have seats if you come later than opening time. Since your pizza comes promptly after your order, most guests stay roughly 30 min. only, huge queue is not always long time. Your table will be assigned with table number at the entrance. English menu is available.

You can choose from wide range of classical and their original Pizza, which is fan, but you cannot enjoy many types because the size is large! Their original tomato sauce is tasty and bread part of the pizza is smooth to eat (a bit salty). The famous fried pizza has a unique shape and good taste but inside cheese may knock out you if you don't share it with other members.
The staff is friendly and will recommend you a suitable wine as well. Must visit.

Small caution. Staff may say ‚ÄúService fee is not included‚Äù but you can consider that table charge is actually charged!

Brilliant pizza place! One of the best in the city away from any tourist spots. Very busy and usually put your name on waiting list then they call you in! The pizza had beautiful tangy sauce with creamy smooth cheese along with fluffy base! Brilliant service considering how busy it is but they keep up the standard of being attentive throughout.

I don't normally eat pizza - it's just not my cup of tea. But I ate three slices here. The pizza was juicy and rich in tomato flavor. The crust had that chewy texture I like, with a crunchy edge. I also appreciated that there was no added sugar to make it sweet. It tasted very natural, and even after eating, you don't feel greasy.

places.address: Via Materdei, 27/28, 80136 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: L'Antica Pizzeria da Michele, a historic pizzeria in Napoli, has been serving what many consider the best pizza in the city for over 150 years. It gained international fame after being featured in 'Eat Pray Love,' attracting both locals and tourists. The pizzeria offers only two types of pizzas - margherita and marinara - making it a vegetarian-friendly spot.

sources.snippet: The scene of the splendid actress Julia Roberts, intent on savoring Neapolitan pizza within the walls of the Antica Pizzeria da Michele, is very famous. That frame, imprinted in our imagination of Neapolitan culture, well explains a golden rule for Neapolitans: if he loves you, she makes you eat.
sources.shortName: Discover 10 romantic things to do in Naples in couple

sources.snippet: For an authentic taste of Naples, visit L‚ÄôAntica Pizzeria da Michele. Established in 1870, this iconic pizzeria is famous for its Margherita and Marinara pizzas. It has only four types of pizza on the menu!.
sources.shortName: Couple's Guide to Naples: Romantic Spots and things to do

sources.snippet: Couples can find an intimate spot at renowned restaurants like Pizzeria Brandi or L‚ÄôAntica Pizzeria da Michele, both known for their authentic and delicious offerings.
sources.shortName: Things to Do for Couples in Naples, Italy: Romantic Activities for Every Season

places.name: L'Antica Pizzeria da Michele

reviews.text:
Absolutely worth the wait - even if it's a long one!
My tip: go around 12 PM, when the line is shorter - we were seated inside within 10 minutes. The interior is spacious and keeps an authentic, slightly old-school charm that adds to the local feel.

And the pizza was incredible.
The tomato sauce was rich and flavorful, the mozzarella was perfect, but the highlight was the beautifully leopard-spotted dough - soft, chewy, and full of character. The portion size was huge (even larger than the plate!), and for the price, it's an amazing deal.

The inside is also pleasantly cool - a huge plus on a hot Neapolitan day - though it does make the mozzarella firm up a little faster. One thing I missed was a house wine option; it would've complemented the meal perfectly.

Bottom line: a must-try spot in Naples.

The pizza was cheap and delicious. We couldn't get a spot at evening so we decided to go in the morning. There was already a queue waiting for the opening of the restaurant. We ate a few pizzas in the city, but this one felt really special. The crust was tasty and the ingredients were good. I would recommend to order 2 different types of pizza and share it with your friend/girlfriend. The only drawback are the plastic-paper cups, which we received for the drinks. Would be great if they could use the glass cups instead.

Gotta try this when in Napoli. The restaurant is unassuming, simple and no frills. We got here early morning just after opening to avoid the queue. There are only seatings indoors and quite tight.

There are only 4 pizza choices: Marinara, Cossoca, Margharita and Marita (combo of marinara and margharita). Very reasonably riced at 6 euros a piece.

Simple drinks menu(not a lot) but this makes it different from the others because they sell simple, no frills, hand made Italian pizzas.

Staffs were helpful, and pizza sizes only come in 1 size‚Ä¶ big!  The plate it comes out with although already large, still the pizza is larger! The pizza sauces were delicious and generous and the crust thin. With the size of pizza, you will never ever come out of the restaurant hungry, you probably won't eat anything for the rest of the day!

It's a good social place, there's are pictures of celebrities like Jude Law and Julia Roberts and others hanging off the wall.

Pram and wheelchair a bit tight and has steps, so maybe stay in the ground floor seatings.

The place was just heaving around lunchtime queuing to come in so come early.

Def a must when in Napoli.

places.address: Via Cesare Sersale, 1, 80139 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Located less than ten minutes from the Capodimonte Museum, the Catacombs of San Gennaro is an underground Christian cemetery dating back to the 2nd and 4th centuries. Visitors can explore this ancient site through guided tours, offering insights into early Christian history, burial practices, and legends surrounding San Gennaro, the city's protector.

sources.snippet: Among the city‚Äôs most fascinating sights, the catacombs of Naples are a network of ancient underground tunnels and chambers that were once used as burial sites. There are three main catacombs open to visitors in Naples: San Gennaro; San Gaudioso; and the Fontanelle Cemetery. The Catacombs of San Gennaro are the largest and most popular catacombs, named for San Gennaro, the patron saint of Naples who was initially buried here (today the remains of the saint are housed in the city‚Äôs 13th-century Duomo).
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things to See in Naples - The Ultimate Guide

sources.snippet: Explore the Catacombs of San Gennaro: The Catacombs of San Gennaro are a unique attraction located beneath the city of Naples. Take a guided tour and explore the ancient underground tombs that date back to the early Christian period.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Naples: what to do?

sources.snippet: Explore the enthralling millennial history buried deep in the ‚ÄòValley of the Dead‚Äô in Naples, and discover the intimate ties of devotion maintained between the city and San Genaro ‚Äì their patron saint.
sources.shortName: 19 Romantic Things to do in Naples for Couples [2024]

places.name: Catacombs of San Gennaro

reviews.text: A must see if you are visiting Naples. Run by a cooperative who employ local young people as guides with profits going into community development activities. One ticket gets access to both catacombs - one of best value tickets in Italy. Don't miss the second tour, just 15 minutes walk down the hill. Interesting contemporary art in the church qnd surrounding streets.

This is a great site to visit while in Naples. You have to go with a tour but tickets are reasonable and with your ticket, you also get a free entry to another catacomb to use within the next year. I suggest buying ahead of time because slots are limited and you may end up having to come back later. They have tours in Italian and English. Our tour guide was amazing and answered any questions anyone had.
The catacombs were super interesting and full of history. Unfortunately there is no photography inside the catacombs (although clearly people don't follow the rules as you can see in the other reviews) so I don't have many pictures to share but it's worth seeing in person!
The the church itself is beautiful and worth the visit. If you have time, don't miss out the tour of the underground treasures, though I did not see it myself

places.address: Via Capodimonte, 13, 80100 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Royal Palace of Naples, a 17th-century palace, boasts period furnishings, a home theatre, and a lavish ballroom that has been restored after war damage. The palace is part of the rich cultural heritage in Naples, along with other attractions such as Castel Sant'Elmo and Museo del Novecento.

sources.snippet: The Royal Palace (Palazzo Reale) and adjacent Piazza del Plebiscito are two of the most recognized landmarks in Naples. The Palazzo Reale was the largest building in Europe when it was built in the 17th century and remains the largest palace in Italy, home to numerous important works of art. Piazza Plebiscito is one of Naples‚Äô main squares of Naples; it was here that a vote was taken in 1860 that led to the country‚Äôs unification, a historic event for which the square is named.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things to See in Naples - The Ultimate Guide

sources.snippet: Visiting the Royal Palace in central Naples is an exquisite experience, with a palace, museum and historic destination of interest all in one.
sources.shortName: 19 Romantic Things to do in Naples for Couples [2024]

sources.snippet: Some of those include the historic building of the Royal Palace, the Medieval Castle Nuovo, and the San Carlo Theatre.
sources.shortName: Honeymoon In Naples | A Romantic Haven

places.name: Royal Palace of Naples

reviews.text:
We have been sight seeing for over a week and this is worth the money if you love art and architecture.  It is breathtaking and you could spend half a day soaking in all of the rooms.  Truly worth the money.  They are doing renovations so gardens were not accessible and one of the upstairs  major rooms... but don't let that stop you from enjoying this amazing historical site.

Note... the theatre room is a great please to cool off and rest a minute if you have been walking a while.

The extra money for the roof top garden access added on was worth it for the views.

Located at Piazza del Plebiscito, 1, 80132 Naples NA, Italy üáÆüáπ.
Admission Ticket - Palace + Galleria del Tempo + Temporary exhibitions
Adults: ‚Ç¨15‚Ä®Reduced: ‚Ç¨ 2‚Ä® (EC visitors aged 18-25)‚Ä® Under 18: free
Gardens Admission Ticket
Romantic Garden: free‚Ä®Roof Garden: ‚Ç¨ 2 + museum ticket without guided visit‚Ä®‚Ç¨ 5 + museum ticket for guided visit
The Palace of Naples is located in the historic centre of Naples. The Palace was built in 1600 onwards by the architect Domenico Fontana as the residence of the Spanish Viceroys. From 1734, Charles of Bourbon made the Palace the primary residence of the Bourbons of Naples for more than a hundred years, first as Kings of Naples and Sicily (1734-1816) and later as Kings of the two Sicilies (1816-1861). It was also the residence for Joseph Bonaparte and Joachim Murat during French rule (1806-1815), during which extensive redecorations were carried out.
The Naples Palace is absolutely beautiful, the architecture and the art are amazing. I did all of it and it was totally worth it. The grandeur of the place, was unbelievable, the staircase alone was fantastic. I totally recommend coming in the morning and beating some of the crowds and also so you can take your time and spend as much time as you want without be worried about the Palace closing. I did an audio guide and personally, I recommend that because I was able to go at my own pace. The history of the palace is so impressive. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend. Thumbs up!!! üëçüëçüëç

Very impressively large each rooms. Although it ended quickly around 30 rooms it is worth visiting. The entrance in April 2025 was 15 eur + 2 eur visiting the gardens upstairs. Visiting the gardens is limited by people.

places.address: Piazza del Plebiscito, 1, 80132 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Via S. Gregorio Armeno, also known as the street of the shepherds, is a must-visit destination in Naples. It is famous for its year-round festive Christmas atmosphere, with stores and workshops specializing in nativity items and crafts. This street is a testimony to the centuries-old tradition of Neapolitan Christmas cribs and offers a feast of colors and craftsmanship.

sources.snippet: At the end of this stage, continue towards San Gregorio Armeno, the famous street of nativity scenes. Here, even in February, the artisans‚Äô workshops will tell stories and centuries-old commitment, giving anyone who wants to know more a show made of never-forgotten traditions. Pay attention to the walls, the alleys, the stones of the various buildings.
sources.shortName: Exploring Naples on Valentine's Day: A Perfect Romantic Itinerary

sources.snippet: For a unique shopping experience, head to Via San Gregorio Armeno, famous for its nativity scene artisans. This street is especially lively during the Christmas season but offers fascinating shops and workshops year-round. It‚Äôs a perfect place to find a special souvenir of your romantic trip.
sources.shortName: Couple's Guide to Naples: Romantic Spots and things to do

places.name: Via S. Gregorio Armeno

reviews.text: Great street cramped full of shops selling Christmas things and other great things . A visual treat and a must for any visit to Naples
Great street full of nice souvenirs to look. Interesting just to wander around and just get lost in the streets.
An alley full of souvenirs from Naples. Definitely worth a visit despite some of the kitschy products. A visit to Naples is not complete without a visit to this alley.

places.address: 80138 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Galleria Borbonica - Ingresso Vico Grottone offers tours of an old tunnel that once connected the palace to military barracks and served as a bomb shelter during WWII. The tunnel, built in 1853 by Ferdinand II, is part of the 17th-century Carmignano Aqueduct system and incorporates 16th-century cisterns. Visitors can take standard tours or opt for more adventurous options like the Adventure Tour or Speleo Light Tour.

sources.snippet: If you want an even more exclusive experience, do not miss the opportunity to experience a Valentine‚Äôs Day on a raft at the Galleria Borbonica: an exclusive visit with a night trip by candlelight that will make you discover the hidden charm of underground Naples, for an unforgettable emotion.
sources.shortName: Exploring Naples on Valentine's Day: A Perfect Romantic Itinerary

places.name: Galleria Borbonica - Ingresso Vico Grottone

reviews.text: This was a very enjoyable tour of the tunnels beneath Naples.  The guide was very knowledgeable telling the history of the tunnels being excavated up until WW2 when they were used as underground bunkers. There are old cars and motorcycles down in the tunnels. At the end of the tour there is a small section where you can buy some antiques from Marco. He is passionate about antiques and is very friendly. If you buy a few items you might get a look at his lock up which is below his shop. Highly recommended and enjoyable tour.

Very insightful visit about how the Royal Palace was built using the volcano stone from below and then was later used as a shelter during the war! You can still see old relics from back in the day. Special thanks to our host Alessandra, she was super competent. The only thing the tour really should have is an age limit‚Ä¶we had a couple of small kids (around 5 or 6), ask about bomb shelters, which is highly inappropriate. It's not a kid-friendly activity.

Fascinating place! Really cool to be able to see 2000 year old aqueducts and even WWII history right under such a vibrant city. Nice thing about this tour is there are no stairs to go back up if you enter down the stairs. Cool little gift shop at the end too.
Was able to get tickets 30 minutes before.

places.address: Vico del Grottone, 3, 80132 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Castel Nuovo, also known as Maschio Angioino, is a medieval fortress in Naples commissioned in 1279. It features five towers and a Renaissance triumphal arch built by King Alfonso. Over the years, it has served as a royal residence and a strategic fortress. Today, it houses a civic art museum and chapel and hosts cultural events. Visitors can explore sumptuous halls on guided tours, including the Armoury Hall and the Palatine.

sources.snippet: There are seven castles in the city and Naples used to be referred to as the ‚Äúcity of the seven castles‚Äù since it was the only place in the world to have so many castles. The two Castel Nuovo and Castel dell Ovo are spectacular. Built in 1279 for the Aragon and Spanish rulers, Castel Nuovo is one of the most scenic and recognizable architectural buildings in Naples.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic THINGS TO DO IN NAPLES ITALY Ideas | by Sutikshan Dwivedi
Travel Naples (and 4,000+ other cities) like a local
19 Romantic Things to do in Naples for Couples [2024]

places.name: Castel Nuovo

reviews.text: Highly recommend it ONLY if you want to get the Tour. You have to pay for the Tour extra tho but it's worth every cent. You learn a lot about the history of the Castel which you would definitely miss when you just walk through by yourself. You can see with the tour the prison as well so it's very interesting. The view from up there is also amazing. But if you don't want to get the tour the 6‚Ç¨ just for the entrance are not worth it. If you want to go there go at the early morning. I went like 10/11 am and there was no queue. When I went outside of the tour (which is an hour) there was a big queue just for the entrance.

Massive old fortress next to the ferry port. There is a museum inside, which I didn't visit but the building itself is something worth seeing. One of the three that we saw in Naples, each more amazing on it's own. It's also well lit in the night.

It's really good. It cost ‚Ç¨6 to get in. Once in they ask you if you want a guided tour. Another ‚Ç¨10 each but you get to see more of the castle and a better understanding of the history of the place. For ‚Ç¨16 each, it's one of the cheapest tours I have found in Italy! We loved the castle and the tour.

places.address: V. Vittorio Emanuele III, 80133 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Dating to 1642, this baroque Roman Catholic church features a polychrome altar & 3 chapels.

sources.snippet: In Posillipo there is also the homonymous Belvedere, located at a lower height than the Terrazza di Sant'Antonio. Despite this, the panorama it is naturally breath-taking, with a view that extends along the coast, es u Palazzo Donn'Anna, which stands out on the sea and where myth and reality merge. Near the lookout is do not miss the Palazzo Petrucci Restaurant, panoramic and very famous for haute cuisine also mentioned in the Michelin guide.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Naples: the unmissable places

places.name: Chiesa di Sant'Antonio a Posillipo

reviews.text: Nice small church tucked away in the hills overlooking Gulf of Napoli. Nice views in the area overlooking the city of Naples and Mount Vesuvius.

Visiting this church was an unforgettable experience. The sanctuary is breathtaking, the grounds are serene, and the view of Naples and the water from the front steps is absolutely unmissable. We are especially grateful to the kind priest who took the time to provide us with blessed rosaries and other keepsakes-an unexpected and deeply meaningful gesture that made our visit even more special. Truly a divine stop in Naples that combines history, beauty, and heartfelt hospitality.
With the funiculore easy to get there. Great view on the Vesuv and Napoli Port. Of course you can also go by foot there.

places.address: Via Minucio Felice, 13, 80122 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: San Domenico Maggiore is an elaborate basilica dating back to the early 1300s, located in the heart of Naples' old town. Built in Gothic style by Carlo d'Angio, it incorporates a pre-existing church from the 10th century BC. The basilica is known for its frescos, sacred relics, and royal family tombs.

sources.shortName: Honeymoon In Naples | A Romantic Haven

places.name: San Domenico Maggiore

reviews.text: Imposing church, heavily reconstructed in the 19th century. The (paid admission = ‚Ç¨10) visit to the sacristy and other spaces covers the whole complex. The guided visits is very knowledgeable, supplying also historical information about History, Architecture, the Dominican Order etc.

Quite an interesting church that has two entrance, one from a nearby plaza through an additional room and stairs next to the altar and another from the street. Monumental inside with lots of richly decorated altars, definitely worth a quick look once you are nearby.

This is an absolute must visit if you're visiting Naples but don't buy tickets from the website. There was no one to greet us as a guide at the time we bought tickets for (we waited half an hour for the ticket office to open at 3pm) and the ticket we bought on the website gave you access to the 3 extra rooms but the one we were actually sent only included two which caused us embarrassment with the lady working in the ticket office who ended up being our guide. She was really nice about it but just something to consider. Buy your ticket when you arrive.

places.address: P.za S. Domenico Maggiore, 8a, 80134 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Belvedere San Martino offers breathtaking panoramic views of Naples, Mount Vesuvius, and the bay. Situated on Vomero hill, it is adjacent to the Charterhouse of San Martino and Castel Sant'Elmo. The terrace is a popular spot for locals and visitors alike, providing an ideal setting for romantic moments or celebratory gatherings. The ascent can be made via steps or a funicular railway.

sources.snippet: One of the most romantic things to do in Naples is certainly a visit to the belvedere of San Martino. We are in the hilly district of Vomero, where you can admire one of the most breathtaking sights in the city. The belvedere overlooks the whole of Naples, you can peer into its every corner, in all its colours.
sources.shortName: 10 romantic things to do in Naples

sources.snippet: The Belvedere of San Martino in the Vomero district offers you one of Naples‚Äô most stunning views. This terrace, popular among the young, is ideal for enjoying the city‚Äôs beauty. Small bistros and a caf√© along the belvedere will provide you with some refreshments while you are admiring the view.
sources.shortName: Couple's Guide to Naples: Romantic Spots and things to do

places.name: Belvedere San Martino

reviews.text: You don't actually need to go into the castle for great views. It is pretty good from the street outside.

Great view.
We climbed on the stairs: 20+ min ~1km... Good to exercise, sweet a lot, but worth it.
A gorgeous view of the whole city poster like. Best point to take a photo with the city as your background. The colorful portrait of buildings and roofs makes you speechless.

places.address: Largo S. Martino, 1, 80129 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Via Toledo, also known as Via Roma, is a bustling pedestrian-only street in downtown Naples that spans over 1.5 kilometers. It is lined with an array of chain stores, boutiques, and historic buildings. The street has a rich history dating back to the 16th century when it was built by the Spanish Viceroy Don Pedro of Toledo.

sources.snippet: Its street markets display the latest trends- Clothes and shoes, antiques and handicrafts, cribs and souvenirs, visitors can shop for anything. The best places you can go for street shopping are Via Toledo, Via Chiaia, Via Dei Mille, and Via San Gregorio Armeno. Via Toledo is the longest shopping street in Naples.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic THINGS TO DO IN NAPLES ITALY Ideas | by Sutikshan Dwivedi

sources.snippet: Immersing yourself among the shops and the multitude of shops in Via Toledo, holding hands, is a unique experience - which allows you to combine a shopping experience with the discovery of the city itself. Then, sitting down to enjoy a good Neapolitan coffee is a unique and unmissable moment.
sources.shortName: Discover 10 romantic things to do in Naples in couple

places.name: Via Toledo

reviews.text: Beautiful metro station, it was funny to go up and down without taking the exit !
Just okay. Some shops but seemed more clothing, etc. if you're into that type of thing, you might enjoy it
Kinda like Madrid but better ! Nice shopping center and amazing street food !!

places.address: Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Mergellina e Porto di Sannazaro offers a delightful escape from the vibrant chaos of Naples' historic center. Strolling along the Lungomare, a picturesque waterfront promenade, you can soak in stunning views of Mount Vesuvius while enjoying the fresh sea breeze. This scenic 3 km stretch begins at Santa Lucia and meanders to Caracciolo, making it perfect for leisurely walks or an afternoon passeggiata.

sources.snippet: Lungomare Caracciolo‚Äôs coastline is beautiful, which gives you a fantastic panoramic view of the city of Naples. On the left side of the Lungomare, one can find the castle, on the right side you will find the heart of Lungomare Caracciolo, namely ‚ÄòVilla Comunale‚Äô. This is a large green area where visitors can relax, sit on a bench, and where children can play openly and freely.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic THINGS TO DO IN NAPLES ITALY Ideas | by Sutikshan Dwivedi

sources.snippet: Enjoy a relaxing walk along Lungomare Caracciolo, a charming waterfront promenade with panoramic views of the Bay of Naples and Mount Vesuvius. Cafes and gelaterias line the lovely road, making it the perfect spot for a relaxed break. As the sun sets, the entire area transforms into a magical place, perfect for a romantic evening walk.
sources.shortName: Couple's Guide to Naples: Romantic Spots and things to do

places.name: Mergellina e Porto di Sannazaro

reviews.text: A beautiful spot to go n gave a walk and see the stunning views of napoli and the stunning boats
Superb place, at night there is a lot of movement, it has a beautiful view. To visit . Absolutely yes.
A lovely place to catch the ferry to Ponza!

places.address: V. Francesco Caracciolo, 80122 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Naples Zoo, located in Italy, has recently undergone renovations and introduced new native and exotic species. The zoo is divided into habitat areas where visitors can learn about the animals and interact with them at the educational farm. Children can explore botanical diversification while enjoying over 400 animals and 200 plant species. Despite its small size, the zoo offers a mix of traditional enclosures and botanical gardens.

sources.snippet: The attractive views and romantic setting of the Naples zoo with a spellbinding, lush green oasis and natural landscapes is as much for couples as it is for kids and families.
sources.shortName: 19 Romantic Things to do in Naples for Couples [2024]
Things to Do for Couples in Naples, Italy: Romantic Activities for Every Season

places.name: Naples Zoo

reviews.text: We had a lovely and unique experience at Lo Zoo di Napoli.  We got to know that there are capybaras in the zoo so we decided to adopt one. Upon arrival the staff welcomed us and were very helpful. Ms Eliana explained to us about other animals and the zoo keepers were very patient to allow us to have a zoo experience with the capybaras and the giraffes. It was a really unforgettable experience. All the staff at the zoo take very good care of all the animals and one can see the care and dedication they have for them. The zoo is also peaceful and clean. I definitely recommend that one visits this zoo! We will surely return someday :)

Loved that the animals were so close. The enclosures were wonderfully clean and the animals looked happy. We've been to zoos all over Europe and this one is one of our favorites. A MUST visit for animal lovers and children. It rained but there wasn't a lot of shade so bring an umbrella.

Despite it being a smaller zoo than others we have been to, there are a fair number of animals here and they all look happy and healthy.

I'm not sure why but the animals were far more interactive at this zoo than usual which made for some really enjoyable moments.

If you are planning on petting some of the animals, make sure to bring some hand sanitiser.

places.address: Viale John Fitzgerald Kennedy, 76, 80125 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Via dei Tribunali is a historic street in Naples that dates back to ancient Greece and Rome. It is lined with significant churches and buildings, including the cathedral of Naples located on Via Duomo, the famous street of the shepherds on Via San Gregorio Armeno, and other important places like Piazza Bellini and Piazza Dante.

sources.snippet: For a more upscale dining experience, head to Via dei Tribunali, a charming street lined with chic eateries and trendy caf√©s.
sources.shortName: Honeymoon In Naples | A Romantic Haven

places.name: Via dei Tribunali

reviews.text:
Must visit street with many shops, restaurants and gift shops.
Some noisy motorcycles but good place to walk.

This street feels almost unreal-like a scene set for tourists, yet it's real life.
You can't help but wonder if people genuinely live here or if it's all a performance. The area is packed with cheesy souvenir shops, street stalls, food vendors, and in between it all-stunning historical churches and places of worship. It's chaotic, vibrant, and full of contrasts. Definitely a must-see when in Naples.
Busy street lots of buildings to see

places.address: Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Basilica Reale Pontificia San Francesco da Paola is a Pantheon-style church adorned with Greek-style columns and filled with sculptures and paintings. The Sezione Navale showcases the history of the Bourbon navy and displays royal barges, while the Sezione Presepiale exhibits Neapolitan nativity scenes from the 18th and 19th centuries.

sources.snippet: Moreover, a visit to the Basilica San Francesco di Paola, or the striking San Carlo Theatre, will provide rich and immersive experiences.
sources.shortName: Things to Do for Couples in Naples, Italy: Romantic Activities for Every Season

places.name: Basilica Reale Pontificia San Francesco da Paola

reviews.text:
The Basilica Reale Pontificia San Francesco di Paola is one of the most important and visually striking churches in Naples. Located in the monumental Piazza del Plebiscito, it is a masterpiece of Neoclassical architecture, inspired by the Roman Pantheon. Dedicated to Saint Francis of Paola, the basilica is not only a symbol of religious devotion but also a testament to the city's Bourbon heritage.

History
1.	Origins:
‚Ä¢	The basilica was commissioned by Ferdinand I of Bourbon in 1816 after he regained the throne of Naples following Napoleon's defeat.
‚Ä¢	The king vowed to dedicate a church to San Francesco di Paola, a revered saint, in gratitude for his restoration to power.
‚Ä¢	Construction began in 1817 and was completed in 1846.
2.	Architect:
‚Ä¢	Designed by Pietro Bianchi, the basilica showcases a harmonious blend of Neoclassical proportions and traditional Catholic symbolism.

Architecture and Features
1.	Exterior:
‚Ä¢	Portico: The basilica features an imposing portico with six Ionic columns and two pilasters, reminiscent of the Pantheon in Rome.
‚Ä¢	Dome: The enormous dome dominates the skyline of Piazza del Plebiscito and serves as a focal point of the square.
2.	Interior:
‚Ä¢	The interior is designed in the shape of a Greek cross, with a central dome supported by sixteen Corinthian columns.
‚Ä¢	The main altar, made of precious marbles, is dedicated to San Francesco di Paola.
‚Ä¢	The walls and chapels are adorned with frescoes, sculptures, and paintings created by renowned Neapolitan artists of the time.
3.	Side Chapels:
‚Ä¢	The basilica contains several chapels dedicated to different saints and themes, including Saint Francis of Assisi, Saint Michael the Archangel, and the Virgin Mary.
‚Ä¢	The artwork in the chapels includes beautiful depictions of Biblical scenes and figures.
4.	Monumentality:
‚Ä¢	With its massive scale and harmonious proportions, the basilica exudes grandeur and reflects the Bourbon monarchy's emphasis on blending power with spirituality.

Religious Significance
‚Ä¢	The church is dedicated to San Francesco di Paola, a 15th-century saint who founded the Order of Minims and is venerated for his piety and miraculous deeds.
‚Ä¢	It remains an active place of worship and a site of deep spiritual significance for the faithful.

Location
‚Ä¢	The basilica stands at the western end of Piazza del Plebiscito, facing the Royal Palace of Naples.
‚Ä¢	Its prominent position within one of Naples' most famous squares makes it a central landmark for both tourists and locals.

Visiting Information
‚Ä¢	Opening Hours: The basilica is generally open to the public, but hours may vary depending on religious services and events.
‚Ä¢	Entrance Fee: Entry to the basilica is typically free, although donations are welcome.
‚Ä¢	Dress Code: Visitors should dress modestly, as it is a place of worship.

Why Visit?

The Basilica Reale Pontificia San Francesco di Paola is a must-visit for anyone exploring Naples. Its impressive architecture, historical significance, and serene interior provide a unique insight into the city's cultural and spiritual heritage. Set against the backdrop of the majestic Piazza del Plebiscito, it is a testament to Naples' enduring artistic and religious traditions.

Although I've been to Naples several times, I somehow missed this incredible site until today. This was my first time seeing it up close-likely because my previous visits were quite short and mostly focused on nearby areas.
I arrived around 7 PM, by which time the place was already closed, so I didn't get the chance to go inside. Still, even from the outside, it was an impressive sight. The building is massive and centrally located, making it hard to miss if you're exploring Naples. What really caught my attention were the numerous statues adorning the front of the structure. They reflect the deep historical and cultural richness of this region of Italy.
Next time I'm in Naples, I'll make sure to visit earlier in the day so I can explore the interior as well. It's clearly a landmark worth experiencing fully.

When you look at this church from Piazza del Plebiscito, you might think: ‚ÄúWait‚Ä¶ haven't I seen this before?‚Äù Yep, it strongly resembles the Roman Pantheon ‚Äì only the Neapolitan version comes with a view of city chaos and the occasional free dose of smog. Built to honor Saint Francis of Paola and to thank God that Napoleon eventually packed up and left. A majestic dome, a peaceful interior, some pigeons outside‚Ä¶ and, unfortunately, a few cardboard homes and piles of trash that slightly ruin the divine impression. The church was built as a thank-you to God for freedom‚Ä¶ but when a guy zooms past you at 150 km/h on an e-scooter, you realize Naples still has its own version of what ‚Äúfreedom‚Äù means. :)

places.address: Piazza del Plebiscito, 80132 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Naples, the Orto Botanico di Napoli is a captivating botanical garden that spans an impressive 12 hectares. Established in 1807, this lush oasis serves as both a research facility and a serene escape from the bustling city life. Visitors can wander through vintage greenhouses and floral pathways, discovering over 1,000 plant species from diverse ecosystems around the globe.
places.name: Orto Botanico di Napoli

reviews.text:
This is the hidden gem in Naples. Medium-sized botanical garden is a great place to rest. Go deeper for a better experience.
Free entrance is also nice. Be aware that entrance has to be manually confirmed (buzzed) by doorkeeper.
There is also a museum of plants/clothes in human life.
Find ultra large lemons üçãüçãüçã. As big as a head. Incredible üò≤.

Hidden gem in the big and loud Naples city ‚ù§Ô∏è we enjoyed spending here our afternoon. There was some market organised exactly that day, but usually it's more quiet and peaceful there as we imagine. A lot of different plants, many paths to go around. Free toilets. And completely free entrance!
You can find some lemon, orange and mandarin trees, and lots of exotic plants that we don't know names. But conveniently most of the trees have small signs with the names and country origin at the bottom

Botanical garden of Napoli really worth visiting. It is propre and well maintained. The ceramic notes and benches are very very nice. Unfortunately the greenhouse was closed. The admission is free, don't hesitate to ring the bell ;)

places.address: Via Foria, 223, 80139 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Trattoria e Pizzeria Spaccanapoli is located in the bustling narrow streets of Naples Centro Storico, known as Spaccanapoli. This vibrant area is filled with buzzing Vespas, artisan workshops, and lively debates among neighbors. The trattoria and pizzeria are situated along a series of linked roads that make up Spaccanapoli, offering a taste of authentic Italian cuisine amidst the historic charm of the UNESCO World Heritage-designated street.

sources.shortName: 19 Romantic Things to do in Naples for Couples [2024]

places.name: Trattoria e Pizzeria Spaccanapoli

reviews.text: Excellent food, nice little courtyard roadside to eat in.  The planes at night time sometimes fly over head which for me was an awesome experience. I would definitely visit them again!

It's always the same issue: you're in the center of a touristy city and you wanna have dinner. Where should you go? Should you rely on Maps knowing that most ratings were set by tourists? ü§î
Not in Barcelona üá™üá∏, for sure. But in Napoli üáÆüáπ, things seemed different as I could see lots of locals in the main touristy streets...
So we decided to follow Maps for our dinner that day and we reached a place with good ratings that was open according to Maps but that was... closed in real life. üò§
Plan B then: Spaccanapoli, a couple of streets away.
The look of the place was kinda cold, not cozy at all.
The waitress was nice even though she recommended that we order the most expensive item on the menu, the fried seafood ü¶ê platter, without telling us about the price upfront... üòí
And the food was more than correct. Especially the seafood that was great. üëç
My son dared to order a pizza üçï with fries üçü on the top which, to me, sounds like a heresy (like pineapple üçç on a pizza üçï) but isn't so strange, apparently, as he already had that on a previous trip to Italy üáÆüáπ. ü§∑
We paid ‚Ç¨22 each, no dessert, no alcohol. It's kinda expensive for Italy üáÆüáπ but yeah, that was mainly due to the seafood platter...

Quality & taste: 8/10
Quantities: 10/10
Atmosphere: 6/10
Originality: 7/10
Ratio price / quality: 8/10
Service: 6/10
How I felt afterwards: 7/10

The food was absolutely delicious, with the pizza being especially perfect-clearly cooked with skill and passion! The small restaurant is located in the city center, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere. I loved the warm ambiance from the wooden-fired fireplace, which added to the charm of the place. Additionally, the prices were quite reasonable, making it a great spot to enjoy a satisfying meal. Thank you for a wonderful dining experience!

places.address: Via San Biagio Dei Librai, 83, 80138 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Parco Virgiliano, also known as the Park of Remembrance, is a terraced hillside park located in the upscale neighborhood of Posillipo in Naples. It offers breathtaking panoramic views of the coastal landscape, including cliff-fringed Capri and the islands of Nisida, Procida, and Ischia dotting the Gulf of Naples. The park features lush Mediterranean maquis vegetation and is a popular spot for walking, jogging, or bike rides.

sources.snippet: We start with Parco Virgiliano, a park located in the hill district of Posillipo. This is a historic space for the city, open every day and consisting of terraces overlooking the entire Gulf of Naples. Moving on to the Vomero we instead find the Villa Floridiana, another great green lung for the city, full of romance and charm, as well as a breathtaking panorama.
sources.shortName: 10 romantic things to do in Naples

places.name: Parco Virgiliano

reviews.text: Park with stunning views over the Gulf of Naples, the islands including Capri. You can drive here or get the bus. Bus 140 has a scenic route. The closest bus stop from there is about 20 minutes walk to the park. The park itself is fairly basic however the views make up for it.

Somehow, like so many parks in Naples, this one is also "being renovated". I think it should be beautiful otherwise. But now you can only stay in front of it and have a view over some abandoned factories.
Amazing views. Authorities should really take care of this park. Entrance is half destroyed. Not to mention the road

places.address: Viale Virgilio, 80123 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Naples International Airport, also known as Naples Capodichino Airport, is the main airport in Campania offering both domestic and international flights. The airport features duty-free shops, rental car services, and convenient city bus links. From Naples, travelers can easily access Rome by train for a day trip or explore the captivating attractions within the region of Campania.

sources.snippet: The Map shows a city map of Naples with main roads and streets, Naples Capodichino Airport is located about 5 km by road north-northeast of the city. The city is located in southwest Italy on the coast by the Gulf of Naples. Mount Vesuvius which is about 9 kilometers east of Naples, the active stratovolcano dominates the city‚Äôs panorama.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic THINGS TO DO IN NAPLES ITALY Ideas | by Sutikshan Dwivedi
Honeymoon In Naples | A Romantic Haven

places.name: Naples International Airport

reviews.text: Naples Airport is a small but efficient airport that offers a surprising number of daily flights to destinations around the world on a variety of airlines. Its compact size makes it easy to navigate-you can get from one part of the airport to another quickly, and going through immigration is usually fast and smooth. While it doesn't have all the amenities you might find at a larger international airport, the essentials are covered. Signage is generally clear, and if you do need assistance, the staff are helpful and approachable. Overall, a convenient and pleasant airport experience.

I recently traveled through Naples Airport (Aeroporto di Napoli) in Italy, and overall, my experience was a bit mixed, leading me to rate it 3 stars. The airport had a nice, festive atmosphere, as it was beautifully decorated for the New Year, which was a pleasant touch and added a bit of holiday cheer to the travel experience.

However, there were several aspects that detracted from the overall convenience. The wait times were quite long, particularly at security and check-in. The process felt inefficient, and it added unnecessary stress to the travel experience. It wasn't just the wait at check-in; there seemed to be delays in other parts of the airport as well, making the entire process feel sluggish.

Customer service was decent but nothing exceptional, landing at a 5/10. Staff members were polite, but I didn't feel they went out of their way to assist or provide clear information. I expected a bit more in terms of service, given that it's an international airport.

One of the more uncomfortable aspects was walking out to the plane in the rain. This was especially inconvenient as I had to stand outside in the weather, which is never ideal. Furthermore, the international flight area felt somewhat isolated from the rest of the airport, with limited access to bathrooms and dining options. This was a bit frustrating, as there were few amenities in that section, which made the wait feel even longer.

While Naples Airport has its strengths, particularly with its festive decorations and good location, the long wait times, less-than-ideal customer service, and lack of amenities for international flights are significant downsides. I would recommend preparing for a less-than-smooth experience if you're passing through this airport.

Worst airport I've ever been to.

Here goes:
- General disorganisation and lack of signage.
- The air conditioning was practically non-existent.
- Hardly any seating available.
- There was also an alarm going off at the gate repeatedly while we waited.
- Gate change last minute.
- Flight delayed.
- The water fountain was broken and the coffee vending machine gave us hot milk.

I will be avoiding this airport at all costs in the future!

places.address: Viale F. Ruffo di Calabria, 80144 Napoli NA, Italy
